TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ECDsa extends System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm
Public MustInherit Class ECDsa Inherits AsymmetricAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Provides an abstract base class that encapsulates the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class serves as the abstract base class for <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng> derivations.

MemberSignature.Value: protected ECDsa ();
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
Protected Sub New ()
protected: ECDsa();

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa> class. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng> class is the only implementation currently supported by the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. You may provide your own custom implementation.

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of an implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the default implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).
Docs.returns: A new instance of the default implementation () of this class.

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the default implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) with a newly generated key over the specified curve.
Docs.returns: A new instance of the default implementation () of this class.

Docs.param: The parameters representing the key to use.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the default implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) using the specified parameters as the key.
Docs.returns: A new instance of the default implementation () of this class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create (string algorithm);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create(string algorithm) cil managed
Public Shared Function Create (algorithm As String) As ECDsa
public: static System::Security::Cryptography::ECDsa ^ Create(System::String ^ algorithm);
static member Create : string -> System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa

Docs.param:
The name of an ECDSA implementation. The following strings all refer to the same implementation, which is the only implementation currently supported in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]:
\- "ECDsa"
\- "ECDsaCng"
\- "System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng"
You can also provide the name of a custom ECDSA implementation.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).
Docs.returns: A new instance of the specified implementation of this class. If the specified algorithm name does not map to an ECDSA implementation, this method returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you develop your own implementation of an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa> object, you can use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa.Create%28System.String%29> method overload to create a custom `algorithm` string that specifies your implementation.
If you specify a custom value for the `algorithm` parameter, the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptoConfig> object will use it to determine whether an ECDSA object can be created.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, exports the explicit parameters for an elliptic curve.
Docs.returns: The parameters representing the point on the curve for this key, using the explicit curve format.
Docs.exception: A derived class must override this method.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, exports the named or explicit parameters for an elliptic curve. If the curve has a name, the field contains named curve parameters, otherwise it contains explicit parameters.
Docs.returns: The parameters representing the point on the curve for this key.
Docs.exception: A derived class must override this method.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the key exchange algorithm.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is inherited from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm> base class.
The Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) is used for digital signature generation; it is not used for key derivation Therefore, this property returns `null`.

Docs.summary: Verifies a digital signature against the specified hash value.
Docs.returns: if the hash value equals the decrypted signature; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The signature is first decrypted by using the public key, and then compared to the hash value for verification.
